Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Analyze the Request Input A process tree model representing Procure-to-Pay process Problem current model underfitting uses PARALLEL operator for activities that should be sequential Standard Logic 1 Create Purchase Requisition 2 Approve Purchase Requisition 3 Create Purchase Order 4 Receive Goods 5 Receive Invoice 6 Match Invoice to PO 7 Pay Invoice 8 Close Case Task Identify issues Propose corrected process tree Explain

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Analyze the Current Model Structure SEQUENCE create_req approve_req PARALLEL create_po receive_goods receive_invoice match_invoice pay_invoice close_case Issues PARALLEL block allows any order Logic violation Pay Invoice before Receive Invoice Match before Create PO or Receive Goods Receive Goods before Create PO

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Determine the Correct Logic Domain Knowledge prompt instructions standard logic strict numbered sequence 1-8 no loops retain same activities enforce sequence Match requires Goods Invoice PO Pay requires Match strict Sequence most conformant

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Consider parallelism Receive Goods and Receive Invoice can happen any order PARALLEL Receive Goods Receive Invoice then Match more realistic but prompt lists 4 then 5 strict order

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Self-Correction Refinement safest strict sequence follows prompt numbered list directly Alternative PARALLEL Goods Invoice deviates from 4 then 5 Decision stick to prompt explicit ordering full SEQUENCE

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Refining Issues parallel ignores causality examples bad behavior Paying without invoice Matching without PO Final Review nested vs flat sequence flat SEQUENCE valid syntax ensures dependencies PO before Goods Invoice Match before Pay

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Drafting Code root ProcessTree operator SEQUENCE children all eight activities in order 1-8 flattens parallel block into sequence Retain activities refine operators prevents underfitting

Name: Counterfactual Reasoning - IND
Text: What if parallel for Goods Invoice violates prompt standard logic list order 4 Receive Goods 5 Receive Invoice strict sequence enforces provided order perfectly
